page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING In this area ,the use of local limestone(Cotswold stone) for the building of the older houses has produced attractive residences.Cream in colour when freshly quarried the limestone weathers after some years to a greyish yellow.Older roofs are of limestone tiles.In the East on the Cotswolds themselves the field boundaries are typically of dry stone limestone walls, but on the lower western area hedges are common. Newer houses are few and are mainly farmworkers' cottages built of a yellowish brick which blends well with the stone.Planning controls have been strong for a long time in this area.
